results.title: Your career: insurance
results.brief_description: Deals with the careers available to young men and women in the field of fire, accident and marine insurance. From correspondence sorting and office work, men can advance to executive positions, insurance inspectors, surveyors, and assessors. Women have the opportunity of careers as typists, punch card accounting machine operators and secretaries. Includes interesting shots of Melbourne and office procedures and equipment of the period (pre 1970s feminism).

results.title: Your body and its parts
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Life Science”.
Provides an overview of human physiology. Illustrates the body parts working together to do a job and forming a system. Introduces the muscular, respiratory, circulatory, skeletal and nervous systems.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Vic Lockwood, Alison Tucker and Caroline Godley
results.brief_description: An informative question and answer format about AIDS presented by Mike Smith and Vicki Licorish. Discusses how the virus is transmitted; what it does to the body; how it affects your partner; the immune system; HIV; condom practice and protection. Includes interviews with AIDS sufferers.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS
results.creator_credit: Katherine Everett, BBC and Stuart McDonald
results.brief_description: Presenters from the Bodymatters Team separate facts from fiction and reveal how much the worldwide experts know about AIDS and its transmission. They explore the challenges ahead and the possibilities of finding a vaccine and a cure. The program dispels some of the myths surrounding the disease and uses giant models of the body to explain the action of the AIDS virus on other healthy cells.

results.title: Your amazing mind
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Opens with a lengthy discussion of the importance of human brain power in the progress of civilisation. Proceeds to discuss the different types of drugs available and the dangers of using them without prescription. Explains various types of drugs and discusses the effects of each on the human brain.

results.title: Young women of Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Illustrates the role of women in Japan’s development in manpower, technical skill and creative talent, by showing examples of young women working in air transport, clothing, graphic design, farming, broadcasting and manufacturing.

results.title: Young voices from the Arab world: the lives and times of five teenagers [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Amideast, Washington, DC and Leslie Nucho
results.brief_description: Five teenagers from various parts of the Arab world share their lives, experiences and hope for the future, providing an insight into everyday aspects of Arab culture and society. Their narratives and different locales reveal a place of contrasts, but also one of similarities in the shared cultural heritage, attitude towards family and religion, continuity and change. Fourteen-year-old Muhammad from Jordan explains how Islam guides his life, in particular the period of Ramadan and the haj. Fourteen-year-old Tamara from Beirut talks about the reconstruction of her city and her aspiration to be an archaeologist. Twelve-year-old Hazem lives in Egypt with his geologist parents and talks of the enjoyment he derives from movies and spending time with friends. Twelve-year-old Sa’ud lives with his extended family in Kuwait and has been told of many of the traditional ways, in danger of disappearing, by his grandmother. Twelve-year-old Khadija from Morocco talks about the differences between her generation and that of her mother. General information is also provided on the demographics, geography, religion, language, trade, industry, family and identity of the Arab world. A detailed teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Young job seekers package
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The segments are titled as follows:- Your first job interview, Preparation, Presentation, Answering questions, Showing initiative, and Improving performance. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.
